item.name: Sites
item.description:
Manage serverless WordPress sites deployed on Vector Pro infrastructure. Sites are
the primary resource representing customer applications, each with associated
environments (staging/production), deployments, and CDN configurations.

Sites are created with a `pending` status and transition to `active` once provisioning
completes. You can suspend sites to reduce costs during low-traffic periods.

## Site Status Lifecycle

- `pending` - Site creation initiated, provisioning in progress
- `active` - Site is fully operational and serving traffic
- `suspended` - Site is paused to reduce costs (can be unsuspended)
- `terminating` - Site deletion in progress
- `terminated` - Site has been fully removed

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all sites for the authenticated account.
Results include each site's environments and their associated domains.
Retrieves details of a specific site including its environments and domains.

Creates a new site for the authenticated account. The site is created with a
`pending` status and will transition to `active` once provisioning completes.

A development container is automatically provisioned for the site, accessible
via the `dev_domain` in the response.

response.name: Validation Error
No Cluster Available

request.description: Updates an existing site's metadata. Only the fields provided will be updated.

response.name: Validation Error

request.description:
Initiates deletion of a site. This terminates the site's development container
and CDN resources. The site status transitions to `terminating` and eventually
`terminated`.

**Important:** All environments must be terminated before the site can be deleted.
Use the environment delete endpoint to terminate each environment first.

This operation is irreversible. All site data and configurations will be
permanently removed.

response.name: Active Environments

variable.description: The source site ID to clone from.

request.description:
Creates a new site by cloning an existing site's development container,
including files and database. Only the development container is cloned;
production and staging environments are not copied. The new site is created
with fresh, empty environments.

This workflow is useful for testing larger redesigns or refactors in
isolation while still allowing maintenance of the original site. The cloned
site operates independently, so changes to one do not affect the other.

The new site inherits attributes from the source site unless overridden in
the request. The cloned site is created with a `pending` status and will
transition to `active` once the clone operation completes.

response.name: Validation Error - Site Not Active
Validation Error - No Dev Container

request.description:
Suspends a site's development container by scaling the ECS service to zero.
This reduces costs during low-traffic periods while preserving container
resources for quick resumption.

The site must be in `active` status to be suspended. Suspended sites can be
resumed using the unsuspend endpoint.

response.name: Invalid State

request.description:
Resumes a previously suspended site's development container by scaling the
ECS service back to one. The site must be in `suspended` status to be unsuspended.

After unsuspension, the site transitions back to `active` status and resumes
serving traffic.

response.name: Invalid State

request.description:
Generates a new SFTP password for the site's development container.
The old password is immediately invalidated.

The new password is returned ONLY in this response - store it securely
as it cannot be retrieved again.

SFTP connection details:
- hostname: ssh.{partner-domain} (e.g., ssh.vectorpages.com)
- port: 22
- username: site subdomain (e.g., my-site)
- password: the generated password

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "partner_customer_id": null,
        "status": "active",
        "dev_php_version": "8.3",
        "tags": [],
        "dev_domain": "my-site.vectorpages.com",
        "dev_sftp": {
            "hostname": "ssh.vectorpages.com",
            "port": 22,
            "username": "my-site",
            "password": "aBcD1234!@#$EfGh5678"
        },
        "environments": [],
        "created_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z"
    },
    "message": "SFTP password reset successfully. Store the new password securely - it will not be shown again.",
    "http_status": 200
}
response.name: Success

request.description:
Generates a new database password for the site's development container.
The old password is immediately invalidated.

The new password is returned ONLY in this response - store it securely
as it cannot be retrieved again.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "account_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDA",
        "partner_customer_id": null,
        "status": "active",
        "dev_php_version": "8.3",
        "tags": [],
        "dev_domain": "site-abc123.vectorpages.com",
        "dev_db_username": "db-01jfgxk4nqrst5vwx9yz0abcde",
        "dev_db_password": "aBcD1234!@#$EfGh5678",
        "environments": [],
        "created_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z"
    },
    "message": "Database password reset successfully. Store the new password securely - it will not be shown again.",
    "http_status": 200
}
response.name: Success

query.description: Drop all existing tables before import. Default: false.
Disable foreign key checks during import. Default: true.

request.description:
Import SQL content directly from the request body. For files under 50MB.
The request body should contain raw SQL content with Content-Type: application/sql.

This is a synchronous operation that blocks until the import completes.

response.body: {"data": {}, "errors": {"content": ["SQL content is required in the request body"]}, "message": "Request body is empty", "http_status": 422}
response.name: Empty Body
Import Failed

request.description:
Create a database import session for large files (>50MB). Returns a presigned
S3 upload URL that can be used to upload the SQL file directly to storage.

After uploading, call the "Run Import" endpoint to execute the import.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDF",
        "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "status": "pending",
        "filename": "backup-2025-01-23.sql",
        "content_length": 104857600,
        "checksum": {"provided_md5": "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e", "s3_etag": null},
        "options": {"drop_tables": true, "disable_foreign_keys": true},
        "upload_url": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/imports/...",
        "upload_expires_at": "2025-01-23T11:00:00+00:00",
        "duration_ms": null,
        "error_message": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-23T10:00:00+00:00",
        "started_at": null,
        "completed_at": null
    },
    "message": "Import session created successfully",
    "http_status": 201
}
response.name: Created

response.body: {"data": {}, "errors": {"content_length": ["The content length must not exceed 10GB."]}, "message": "Validation failed", "http_status": 422}
response.name: Validation Error

request.description:
Execute a database import from S3 after the file has been uploaded via the
presigned URL. Dispatches an async job to perform the import.

The import must be in `pending` or `uploaded` status and not expired.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDF",
        "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "status": "uploaded",
        "filename": "backup-2025-01-23.sql",
        "content_length": 104857600,
        "checksum": {"provided_md5": "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e", "s3_etag": null},
        "options": {"drop_tables": true, "disable_foreign_keys": true},
        "duration_ms": null,
        "error_message": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-23T10:00:00+00:00",
        "uploaded_at": "2025-01-23T10:00:30+00:00",
        "started_at": null,
        "completed_at": null
    },
    "message": "Database import started",
    "http_status": 202
}
response.name: Accepted

response.body: {"data": {}, "errors": {"status": ["Import must be in pending or uploaded status"]}, "message": "Import is not ready to run", "http_status": 422}

response.body: {"data": {}, "errors": {"expires_at": ["Please create a new import session"]}, "message": "Import session has expired", "http_status": 422}

request.description:
Get the current status of a database import operation. If the import is still
pending and not expired, includes a fresh presigned upload URL.

Start a database export operation. Dispatches an async job to create
the export and upload it to S3. Poll the status endpoint to check progress
and retrieve the download URL when complete.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDG",
        "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",

}

Get the current status of a database export operation. If complete and not
expired, includes a presigned download URL valid for 1 hour.

item.name: Environments
item.description:
Manage deployment environments for sites. Each site can have multiple environments
with their own domains, PHP versions, and secrets. Environment names use a slug format
(lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens).

Environments are created with a `pending` status and transition to `active` once
container provisioning completes. Each environment gets a unique subdomain under
your registered domain.

## Environment Status Lifecycle

- `pending` - Environment creation initiated, provisioning in progress
- `active` - Environment is fully operational
- `suspended` - Environment is paused
- `terminating` - Environment deletion in progress
- `terminated` - Environment has been fully removed

## Production Environment

Each site can have at most one production environment (`is_production: true`).
The production environment receives CDN integration via Bunny.net.

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all environments for a specific site.
Retrieves details of a specific environment.

Creates a new environment for a site. The environment is created with a
`pending` status and will transition to `active` once provisioning completes.

Each environment gets a unique auto-generated subdomain and uses the site's
configured domain.

**Important:** Only one environment per site can be marked as production
(`is_production: true`). The production environment receives CDN integration.

response.name: Validation Error

request.description: Updates an existing environment. Only the fields provided will be updated.

response.name: Validation Error

request.description:
Initiates deletion of an environment. This terminates all associated
containers, deployments, and CDN resources. The environment status
transitions to `terminating` and eventually `terminated`.

This operation is irreversible. All environment data will be permanently removed.

Rotates the database password for a production environment via Ymir.
The old password is immediately invalidated.

The new password is returned ONLY in this response - store it securely
as it cannot be retrieved again.

**Important:** After rotating the password, you must redeploy the environment
for your application to pick up the new credentials.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDG",
        "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "partner_customer_id": "customer-123",
        "name": "production",
        "is_production": true,
        "status": "active",
        "provisioning_step": "complete",
        "failure_reason": null,
        "php_version": "8.3",
        "tags": [],
        "fqdn": "wispy-dust.vectorpages.com",
        "custom_domain": "example.com",
        "subdomain": "wispy-dust",
        "database_user": "user_abc123_production",
        "database_password": "aBcD1234!@#$EfGh5678",
        "created_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00.000000Z"
    },
    "message": "Database password reset successfully. Store the new password securely - it will not be shown again. Remember to redeploy your environment.",
    "http_status": 200
}
response.name: Success

response.body: {"data": {}, "message": "Environment does not have a database user configured. Deploy the environment first.", "http_status": 400}
response.name: No Database User

item.name: Deployments
item.description:
Manage code deployments to environments. Each deployment represents a release of
your WordPress site to a specific environment (staging or production).

Deployments are created with a `pending` status and progress through `deploying`
to either `deployed` (success) or `failed`. Each deployment records the actor
who initiated it and timing information.

## Deployment Status Lifecycle

- `pending` - Deployment created, waiting to start
- `deploying` - Deployment in progress
- `deployed` - Deployment completed successfully
- `failed` - Deployment failed (check stdout/stderr for details)

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all deployments for a specific environment,
ordered by most recent first.
Retrieves details of a specific deployment including output logs and actor information.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDH",
        "vector_environment_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDG",
        "status": "deployed",
        "stdout": "Building project...\nUploading assets...\nDeployment complete.",
        "stderr": null,
        "actor": "john@example.com",
        "environment": {
            "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDG",
            "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
            "partner_customer_id": "cust_123456",
            "name": "production",
            "is_production": true,
            "status": "active",
            "php_version": "8.3",
            "tags": ["wordpress"],
            "fqdn": "example.com",
            "custom_domain": "example.com",
            "subdomain": "wispy-dust",
            "created_at": "2025-05-20T09:00:00+00:00",
            "updated_at": "2025-05-27T09:55:30+00:00"
        },
        "created_at": "2025-05-27T09:50:21+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2025-05-27T09:55:30+00:00"
    },
    "message": "Deployment retrieved successfully",
    "http_status": 200
}
response.name: Success

request.description:
Triggers a new deployment for the environment. The deployment starts with
`pending` status and progresses through `deploying` to either `deployed`
or `failed`.

The authenticated user is recorded as the deployment actor.

Triggers a rollback for the environment. By default, rolls back to the last
successful deployment. Optionally, you can specify a target_deployment_id to
rollback to a specific previous deployment.

The rollback creates a new deployment record with `pending` status that progresses
through `running` to either `completed` or `failed`.

response.body: {"data": {}, "errors": {"target_deployment_id": ["The specified deployment does not exist for this environment or has no Ymir deployment ID."]}, "message": "Validation failed", "http_status": 422}
response.name: Validation Error

item.name: Environment Secrets
item.description:
Manage environment-level secrets for a specific environment. These secrets are
injected as environment variables during site deployment and are scoped to
a single environment.

Secret values are never returned in API responses for security. Certain keys
are reserved for system use and cannot be used.

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all secrets for a specific environment.
Secret values are not included in the response for security.

Retrieves details of a specific environment secret.
The secret value is not included in the response for security.

Creates a new secret for a specific environment. The secret will be available
to this environment during deployment.

The following keys are reserved and cannot be used:

- AUTH_KEY
- SECURE_AUTH_KEY
- LOGGED_IN_KEY
- NONCE_KEY
- AUTH_SALT
- SECURE_AUTH_SALT
- LOGGED_IN_SALT
- NONCE_SALT
- AUTOMATIC_UPDATER_DISABLED
- DISABLE_WP_CRON
- DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT
- DISALLOW_FILE_MODS
- DOMAIN_CURRENT_SITE
- WP_HOME
- WP_SITEURL
- YMIR_ASSETS_PATH

- YMIR_CACHE_TABLE
- YMIR_CDN_IMAGE_PROCESSING_ENABLED

- YMIR_PRIMARY_DOMAIN_NAME
- YMIR_PROJECT_TYPE
- YMIR_PUBLIC_STORE
- YMIR_REDIS_ENDPOINT
- YMIR_SECRETS_PATH
- YMIR_UPLOAD_URL
- _HANDLER
- AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
- AWS_EXECUTION_ENV
- AWS_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_MEMORY_SIZE
- AWS_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_NAME
- AWS_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_VERSION
- AWS_LAMBDA_LOG_GROUP_NAME

- AWS_REGION
- AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
- AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
- LAMBDA_RUNTIME_DIR
- LAMBDA_TASK_ROOT
- TZ

Updates an existing environment secret. You can update the key, value, or both.

The following keys are reserved and cannot be used:

- AUTH_KEY
- SECURE_AUTH_KEY
- LOGGED_IN_KEY
- NONCE_KEY
- AUTH_SALT

item.name: Events
item.description:
View event logs for Vector Pro resources. Events are logged automatically when
actions occur (site creation, deployments, etc.) and are retained for 90 days.

Event logs provide an audit trail of all activity in your account.

## Available Event Types

### Site Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.site.pending` | Site provisioning has been queued |
| `vector.site.created` | Site has been fully provisioned |
| `vector.site.updated` | Site settings have been modified |
| `vector.site.deleted` | Site has been terminated |
| `vector.site.suspended` | Site has been suspended |
| `vector.site.unsuspended` | Site has been unsuspended |

### Dev Site Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.dev-site.created` | Development container has been provisioned |
| `vector.dev-site.suspended` | Development container has been suspended |
| `vector.dev-site.unsuspended` | Development container has been unsuspended |
| `vector.dev-site.terminated` | Development container has been terminated |
| `vector.dev-site.sftp-password-reset` | SFTP password has been reset |
| `vector.dev-site.database-password-reset` | Database password has been reset |
| `vector.dev-site.ssh-key-added` | SSH key has been added to dev container |
| `vector.dev-site.ssh-key-removed` | SSH key has been removed from dev container |
| `vector.dev-site.db-import-started` | Database import has started |
| `vector.dev-site.db-import-completed` | Database import completed successfully |
| `vector.dev-site.db-import-failed` | Database import failed |
| `vector.dev-site.db-export-started` | Database export has started |
| `vector.dev-site.db-export-completed` | Database export completed successfully |
| `vector.dev-site.db-export-failed` | Database export failed |

### SSH Key Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.ssh-key.created` | SSH key has been created |
| `vector.ssh-key.deleted` | SSH key has been deleted |

### Environment Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.environment.created` | Production environment has been created |
| `vector.environment.updated` | Environment settings have been modified |
| `vector.environment.deleted` | Environment has been deleted |
| `vector.environment.suspended` | Environment has been suspended |
| `vector.environment.unsuspended` | Environment has been unsuspended |
| `vector.environment.database-password-reset` | Database password has been reset |

### Deployment Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.deployment.started` | Deployment to production has started |
| `vector.deployment.completed` | Deployment completed successfully |
| `vector.deployment.failed` | Deployment failed |

### CDN Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.cdn.setup-started` | CDN configuration has started |
| `vector.cdn.setup-completed` | CDN setup completed successfully |
| `vector.cdn.setup-failed` | CDN setup failed |

### DNS Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.dns.record-created` | DNS record has been created |
| `vector.dns.record-deleted` | DNS record has been deleted |

### Webhook Events

| Event | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `vector.webhook.created` | Webhook endpoint has been registered |
| `vector.webhook.updated` | Webhook configuration has been modified |
| `vector.webhook.deleted` | Webhook endpoint has been removed |

query.description: Filter events that occurred on or after this timestamp (ISO 8601).
Filter events that occurred on or before this timestamp (ISO 8601).
Filter by event type(s). Accepts a single event or comma-separated list.
Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of event logs for the authenticated account.
Logs are returned in reverse chronological order (newest first).

Event logs are automatically pruned after 90 days.

item.name: Global Secrets
item.description:
Manage account-level secrets that are available to all sites within your account.
These secrets are injected as environment variables during site deployment.

Global secrets apply to all environments across all sites in your account. For
environment-specific secrets, use the Environment Secrets API instead.

Secret values are never returned in API responses for security. Certain keys
are reserved for system use and cannot be used.

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all global secrets for your account.
Secret values are not included in the response for security.

Retrieves details of a specific global secret.
The secret value is not included in the response for security.

Creates a new global secret for your account. The secret will be available
to all sites within your account during deployment.

The following keys are reserved and cannot be used:

- AUTH_KEY
- SECURE_AUTH_KEY
- LOGGED_IN_KEY
- NONCE_KEY
- AUTH_SALT
- SECURE_AUTH_SALT
- LOGGED_IN_SALT
- NONCE_SALT
- AUTOMATIC_UPDATER_DISABLED
- DISABLE_WP_CRON
- DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT
- DISALLOW_FILE_MODS
- DOMAIN_CURRENT_SITE
- WP_HOME
- WP_SITEURL
- YMIR_ASSETS_PATH
- YMIR_ASSETS_URL
- YMIR_CACHE_PREFIX
- YMIR_CACHE_TABLE
- YMIR_CDN_IMAGE_PROCESSING_ENABLED
- YMIR_DISTRIBUTION_ID
- YMIR_DOMAIN_NAMES
- YMIR_ENVIRONMENT
- YMIR_MAX_EXECUTION_TIME
- YMIR_PRIMARY_DOMAIN_NAME
- YMIR_PROJECT_TYPE
- YMIR_PUBLIC_STORE
- YMIR_REDIS_ENDPOINT
- YMIR_SECRETS_PATH
- YMIR_UPLOAD_URL
- _HANDLER
- AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
- AWS_EXECUTION_ENV
- AWS_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_MEMORY_SIZE
- AWS_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_NAME
- AWS_LAMBDA_FUNCTION_VERSION
- AWS_LAMBDA_LOG_GROUP_NAME
- AWS_LAMBDA_LOG_STREAM_NAME
- AWS_LAMBDA_RUNTIME_API
- AWS_REGION
- AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
- AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
- LAMBDA_RUNTIME_DIR
- LAMBDA_TASK_ROOT
- TZ

Updates an existing global secret. You can update the key, value, or both.

The following keys are reserved and cannot be used:

automatically installed on new dev sites when they are created.

endpoints instead.

item.name: SSL
item.description:
Manage SSL provisioning for Vector environments.

SSL is automatically provisioned when environments are deployed. These endpoints
provide visibility into SSL status and manual intervention capabilities when
provisioning gets stuck.

## Environment Status

The main `status` field tracks the environment lifecycle:
- `pending` - Environment created, awaiting first deploy
- `provisioning` - Resources being provisioned (including SSL)
- `active` - Environment fully operational
- `failed` - Provisioning failed

## Provisioning Step

The `provisioning_step` field tracks detailed progress during provisioning:
- `null` - Not started
- `requesting_cert` - Requesting AWS ACM certificate
- `waiting_cert` - Waiting for certificate validation
- `deploying` - Deploying to Ymir
- `configuring_dns` - Configuring DNS records
- `ready` - Platform SSL complete (terminal for staging)
- `waiting_custom_dns` - Waiting for custom domain DNS (production only)
- `provisioning_cdn_ssl` - Requesting Let's Encrypt certificate
- `complete` - Fully complete (terminal for production with custom domain)

request.description: Get the current SSL provisioning status for an environment.

Manually nudge SSL provisioning for an environment. Use this when SSL
provisioning appears to be stuck or to retry after a failure.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDG",
        "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "partner_customer_id": "customer-123",
        "name": "production",
        "is_production": true,
        "status": "provisioning",
        "provisioning_step": "deploying",
        "failure_reason": null,
        "php_version": "8.3",
        "tags": [],
        "fqdn": "wispy-dust.vectorpages.com",
        "custom_domain": "example.com",
        "subdomain": "wispy-dust",
        "created_at": "2025-05-27T09:50:21+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2025-05-27T09:55:42+00:00"
    },
    "message": "SSL provisioning advanced from waiting_cert to deploying",
    "http_status": 200
}
response.name: Advanced

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDG",
        "vector_site_id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDE",
        "partner_customer_id": "customer-123",
        "name": "production",
        "is_production": true,
        "status": "provisioning",
        "provisioning_step": "waiting_custom_dns",
        "failure_reason": null,
        "php_version": "8.3",
        "tags": [],
        "fqdn": "wispy-dust.vectorpages.com",
        "custom_domain": "example.com",

    },

}

item.name: Rate Limits
item.description:
Manage WAF rate limiting rules for a site.

Rate limits protect your site against DDoS attacks, brute force attempts, and API abuse by
limiting request frequency based on configurable thresholds. When a client exceeds the
allowed request count within the specified timeframe, they are blocked for the configured
block duration.

## How Rate Limiting Works

Each rule defines:
- **Threshold**: Number of requests (`request_count`) allowed within a time window (`timeframe`)
- **Block Duration**: How long to block offending clients (`block_time`)
- **Matching Criteria**: Which requests to count using `variables`, `operator`, and `value`
- **Transformations**: Data normalization applied before matching

## Limits

- Maximum **25 rate limit rules** per site/zone
- `timeframe` must be exactly **1** (per second) or **10** (per 10 seconds)
- `block_time` must be one of: **30**, **60**, **300**, **900**, **1800**, **3600** seconds

## Available Operators

| Value | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `begins-with` | Value starts with pattern |
| `ends-with` | Value ends with pattern |
| `contains` | Value contains pattern anywhere |
| `contains-word` | Value contains pattern as whole word |
| `str-match` | String pattern match |
| `eq` | Numeric equals |
| `ge` | Numeric greater than or equal |
| `gt` | Numeric greater than |
| `le` | Numeric less than or equal |
| `lt` | Numeric less than |
| `within` | Value is within set |
| `regex` | Regular expression match |
| `str-eq` | Exact string equals |
| `detect-sqli` | SQL injection detection (Premium) |
| `detect-xss` | XSS detection (Premium) |

## Available Variables

| Value | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `request-uri` | Request URI (normalized) |
| `request-uri-raw` | Request URI (raw, unnormalized) |
| `args` | All request arguments |
| `args-combined-size` | Total size of all arguments |
| `args-get` | GET query parameters |
| `args-get-names` | Names of GET parameters |
| `args-post` | POST body parameters |
| `args-post-names` | Names of POST parameters |
| `files-names` | Uploaded file names |
| `geo` | Geographic location (Premium) |
| `remote-addr` | Client IP address |
| `query-string` | Full query string |
| `request-basename` | Filename from URI |
| `request-body` | Full request body (Premium) |
| `request-cookies-names` | Cookie names |
| `request-cookies` | Cookie values |
| `request-filename` | Full file path from URI |
| `request-headers-names` | Header names |
| `request-headers` | Header values |
| `request-line` | Full HTTP request line |
| `request-method` | HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.) |
| `request-protocol` | HTTP protocol version |
| `response-body` | Response body (Premium) |
| `response-headers` | Response headers |
| `response-status` | Response status code |

## Available Transformations

| Value | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `cmdline` | Normalize command line |
| `compress-whitespace` | Collapse whitespace |
| `css-decode` | Decode CSS escapes |
| `hex-encode` | Hex encode |
| `html-entity-decode` | Decode HTML entities |
| `js-decode` | Decode JavaScript escapes |
| `length` | Get string length |
| `lowercase` | Convert to lowercase |
| `md5` | MD5 hash |
| `normalize-path` | Normalize path (Unix) |
| `normalise-path` | Normalize path (alias) |
| `normalize-path-win` | Normalize path (Windows) |
| `normalise-path-win` | Normalize path Windows (alias) |
| `remove-comments` | Strip comments |
| `remove-nulls` | Remove null bytes |
| `remove-whitespace` | Remove all whitespace |
| `replace-comments` | Replace comments with space |
| `sha1` | SHA1 hash |
| `url-decode` | URL decode |
| `url-decode-uni` | URL decode with Unicode |
| `utf8-to-unicode` | Convert UTF-8 to Unicode |

request.description: Retrieves all rate limit rules configured for a site. Maximum 25 rules per zone.

response.name: Success

request.description: Retrieves a specific rate limit rule by ID.

response.name: Success

request.description: Creates a new rate limit rule for a site. Maximum 25 rate limit rules per zone.

item.name: Webhooks

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of all webhooks for the authenticated account.
Webhook secrets are never included in list responses.

Retrieves details of a specific webhook. The secret is never included
in this response - use the rotate-secret endpoint if you need a new secret.

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of delivery logs for a specific webhook.
Logs are returned in reverse chronological order (newest first).

Each log entry includes the event type, request payload, response details,
and latency information. Logs are automatically pruned after 90 days.

Creates a new webhook for the current account. For HTTP webhooks, the secret
is returned ONLY in this response - store it securely as it cannot be
retrieved again (only rotated via the rotate-secret endpoint).

Slack webhooks do not require secrets as they use URL-based authentication.

response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "id": "01JFGXK4NQRST5VWX9YZ0ABCDI",
        "account_id": 1,
        "type": "http",
        "url": "https://example.com/webhook",
        "events": ["vector.site.created", "vector.deployment.completed"],
        "secret": "a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234abcd",
        "enabled": true,
        "created_at": "2025-05-27T09:50:21+00:00",
        "updated_at": "2025-05-27T09:50:21+00:00"
    },
    "message": "Webhook created successfully. Store the secret securely - it will not be shown again.",
    "http_status": 201
}
response.name: HTTP Webhook Created
Validation Error

request.description:
Updates an existing webhook configuration. The secret cannot be updated
through this endpoint - use the rotate-secret endpoint instead.

The webhook type cannot be changed after creation.

response.name: Validation Error

request.description:
Deletes a webhook. All associated delivery logs will also be deleted.
This operation is irreversible.

Generates a new secret for the webhook. The old secret is immediately
invalidated and any pending deliveries will use the new secret.

The new secret is returned ONLY in this response - store it securely
as it cannot be retrieved again.

This endpoint is only available for HTTP webhooks. Slack webhooks do not
use secrets.

response.name: Success

item.name: API Keys
item.description:
Manage API access tokens for authentication. Tokens provide Bearer token
authentication for all API requests.

The plain text token is returned only once when created - store it securely
as it cannot be retrieved again. Tokens can be revoked at any time.

## Usage

Include the token in the `Authorization` header:

```
Authorization: Bearer {your-api-token}
```

query.description: Number of items per page (max 100). Default: 15.
Page number for pagination. Default: 1.

request.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of API keys for the authenticated user.
Token values are never returned - only metadata like name, creation date,
and last used timestamp.

response.name: Success

request.description:
Creates a new API key for the authenticated user. The plain text token is
returned ONLY in this response - store it securely as it cannot be
retrieved again.

Use this token in the `Authorization` header for all API requests.

Token names are automatically prefixed with `vector-` for identification.

## Abilities

Abilities control what operations the token can perform. Available abilities:

- `*` - Full access (default)
- `vector:mcp` - Full MCP access (for AI assistants like Claude)
- `vector:sites:read` - Read sites, environments, deployments, database operations
- `vector:sites:write` - Manage sites, environments, deployments, database import/export
- `vector:logs:read` - Read site logs
- `vector:cdn:read` - Read CDN settings
- `vector:cdn:write` - Manage CDN settings and cache
- `vector:webhooks:read` - Read webhooks
- `vector:webhooks:write` - Manage webhooks
- `vector:secrets:read` - Read API keys and global secrets
- `vector:secrets:write` - Manage API keys and global secrets
- `vector:ssh-keys:read` - Read SSH keys
- `vector:ssh-keys:write` - Manage SSH keys

response.name: Created

request.description:
Deletes an API key. You cannot delete the token currently being used
for authentication. This operation is irreversible.

response.name: Success

response.body: {"data": {}, "message": "Cannot delete the token currently in use", "http_status": 403}
response.name: Cannot Delete Current Token
